content.raw: The wrench gets applied correctly and the `WorldForce`/`WorldTorque` accessors are (arguably) correct as well. There is just some ambiguity about what it means to query a simulation engine for the `WorldForce` or the `WorldTorque`. Are we asking for the forces and torques that are about to be applied, or are we asking for the forces and torques that were applied during the last time step? DART interprets it as the former while ODE interprets it as the latter. The default behavior of DART is to clear out the forces and torques after a simulation step has occurred to make it easier for the user to begin applying new forces using `addForce` functions, so by default the forces and torques that were applied prior to the last step forward will no longer be available after the step, unless this default behavior is overridden.
